result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandy C Leeper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and IS Eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Probation may be transferred to the State of California.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs. Paid in full. Balance refunded to poster. Court waives DNA Surcharge and specimen.

Submit to an AODA assessment, (within 60 Days of transferring to another State)  follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: FIRST 60 days are STRAIGHT TIME. Balance Non-Working hours. Release for standard conditions, commencing forthwith.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brandy C Leeper in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph J. Dorlack.   Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Arguments by both counsel.  Court passes matter to attend to another matter.  Sentencing hearing resumed.  

Court orders the following:

Count 1:
- Total sentence: 2 years (Initial Confinement: 1 year, Extended Supervision: 1 year) STAYED
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- 3 years Probation.  Probation may be transferred to California.
- Court costs of $278.00; cash bail to be applied.  Any remaining cash to be refunded to poster.
- DNA Surcharge waived
- DNA Sample waived
- Conditions of Probation:  Submit to an AODA assessment (within 60 days of transferring to new state) and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs. No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  
CONDITION TIME: 4 months - STRAIGHT TIME - To commence FORTHWITH.  If defendant has a job lead she may write to the Court to reconsider granting Huber privileges.  Court would consider modifying the Condition Time after defendant serves 90 days and upon written request of the defendant.

Count 2:
- Total sentence: 2 years (Initial Confinement: 1 year, Extended Supervision: 1 year) CONSECUTIVE to Count 1.  STAYED
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- 3 years Probation.  Probation may be transferred to California.
- Court costs waived
- DNA Surcharge waived
- DNA Sample waived
- Conditions of Probation:  Same as Count 1.
